page.title: 20Rodbourne Angrove Wood
page.content: This is a 21 acre deciduous wood, 3km S.W. of{Malmesbury.}When{Mrs. Fry}of{ {Coach house, Cole Park}bought the land in{1954,}it had been very neglected. She started to plant{3000 trees}and cleared the paths and rides, which still have to be cleared each year. She has planted young trees every year and someone is working in the wood every day. She has replaced trees killed by{Dutch Elm Disease,}with{ {Sycamore, Oak, Birch, Beech, Chestnut, {Regenerated Elm}and others. Mr. Fry planted a{Hazel coppice.}They have also planted an area of{Conifers.}The most recently planted tree is a Scarlet Oak planted in 1984. The different kinds of trees make a good habitat for a wide variety of birds, animals and plants.{In a recent bird {count, 48 species were recorded. }
